trans-unit.source: [EventProcessorHost] is a .NET class that simplifies receiving events from Event Hubs by managing persistent checkpoints and parallel receives from those Event Hubs.
trans-unit.target: [EventProcessorHost] is a .NET class that simplifies receiving events from Event Hubs by managing persistent checkpoints and parallel receives from those Event Hubs.

trans-unit.source: Using [EventProcessorHost], you can split events across multiple receivers, even when hosted in different nodes.
trans-unit.target: Using [EventProcessorHost], you can split events across multiple receivers, even when hosted in different nodes.

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to use [EventProcessorHost] for a single receiver.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to use [EventProcessorHost] for a single receiver.

trans-unit.source: The [Scaled out event processing] sample shows how to use [EventProcessorHost] with multiple receivers.
trans-unit.target: The [Scaled out event processing] sample shows how to use [EventProcessorHost] with multiple receivers.

trans-unit.source: In order to use [EventProcessorHost], you must have an [Azure Storage account]:
trans-unit.target: In order to use [EventProcessorHost], you must have an [Azure Storage account]:

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure portal], and click NEW at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure portal], and click NEW at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click Data Services, then Storage, then Quick Create, and then type a name for your storage account.
trans-unit.target: Click Data Services, then Storage, then Quick Create, and then type a name for your storage account.

trans-unit.source: Select your desired region, and then click Create Storage Account.
trans-unit.target: Select your desired region, and then click Create Storage Account.

trans-unit.source: Click the newly created storage account, and then click Manage Access Keys:
trans-unit.target: Click the newly created storage account, and then click Manage Access Keys:

trans-unit.source: Copy the access key to use later in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Copy the access key to use later in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, create a new Visual C# Desktop App project using the Console Application project template.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, create a new Visual C# Desktop App project using the Console Application project template.

trans-unit.source: Name the project Receiver.
trans-unit.target: Name the project Receiver.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click the solution, and then click Manage NuGet Packages.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click the solution, and then click Manage NuGet Packages.

trans-unit.source: The Manage NuGet Packages dialog box appears.
trans-unit.target: The Manage NuGet Packages dialog box appears.

trans-unit.source: Search for Microsoft Azure Service Bus Event Hub - EventProcessorHost, click Install, and accept the terms of use.
trans-unit.target: Search for Microsoft Azure Service Bus Event Hub - EventProcessorHost, click Install, and accept the terms of use.

trans-unit.source: This downloads, installs, and adds a reference to the <linkText>Azure Service Bus Event Hub - EventProcessorHost NuGet package</linkText><title></title>, with all its dependencies.
trans-unit.target: This downloads, installs, and adds a reference to the <linkText>Azure Service Bus Event Hub - EventProcessorHost NuGet package</linkText><title></title>, with all its dependencies.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Receiver project, click Add, and then click Class.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Receiver project, click Add, and then click Class.

trans-unit.source: Name the new class SimpleEventProcessor, and then click OK to create the class.
trans-unit.target: Name the new class SimpleEventProcessor, and then click OK to create the class.

trans-unit.source: Add the following statements at the top of the SimpleEventProcessor.cs file:
trans-unit.target: Add the following statements at the top of the SimpleEventProcessor.cs file:

trans-unit.source: Then, substitute the following code for the body of the class:
trans-unit.target: Then, substitute the following code for the body of the class:

trans-unit.source: This class will be called by the EventProcessorHost to process events received from the Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: This class will be called by the EventProcessorHost to process events received from the Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Note that the SimpleEventProcessor class uses a stopwatch to periodically call the checkpoint method on the EventProcessorHost context.
trans-unit.target: Note that the SimpleEventProcessor class uses a stopwatch to periodically call the checkpoint method on the EventProcessorHost context.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that, if the receiver is restarted, it will lose no more than five minutes of processing work.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that, if the receiver is restarted, it will lose no more than five minutes of processing work.

trans-unit.source: In the Program class, add the following using statements at the top:
trans-unit.target: In the Program class, add the following using statements at the top:

trans-unit.source: Then, modify the Main method to the Program class as shown below, substituting the Event Hub name and connection string, and the storage account and key that you copied in the previous sections:
trans-unit.target: Then, modify the Main method to the Program class as shown below, substituting the Event Hub name and connection string, and the storage account and key that you copied in the previous sections:

trans-unit.source: This tutorial uses a single instance of [EventProcessorHost].
trans-unit.target: This tutorial uses a single instance of [EventProcessorHost].

trans-unit.source: To increase throughput, it is recommended that you run multiple instances of [EventProcessorHost], as shown in the [Scaled out event processing] sample.
trans-unit.target: To increase throughput, it is recommended that you run multiple instances of [EventProcessorHost], as shown in the [Scaled out event processing] sample.

trans-unit.source: In those cases, the various instances automatically coordinate with each other in order to load balance the received events.
trans-unit.target: In those cases, the various instances automatically coordinate with each other in order to load balance the received events.

trans-unit.source: If you want multiple receivers to each process all the events, you must use the ConsumerGroup concept.
trans-unit.target: If you want multiple receivers to each process all the events, you must use the ConsumerGroup concept.

trans-unit.source: When receiving events from different machines, it might be useful to specify names for [EventProcessorHost] instances based on the machines (or roles) in which they are deployed.
trans-unit.target: When receiving events from different machines, it might be useful to specify names for [EventProcessorHost] instances based on the machines (or roles) in which they are deployed.

trans-unit.source: For more information about these topics, refer to the [Event Hubs Overview] and [Event Hubs Programming Guide] topics.
trans-unit.target: For more information about these topics, refer to the [Event Hubs Overview] and [Event Hubs Programming Guide] topics.
